text: Thomas Somerset or Pophull (fl. 1379–1393, died between 1396 and 1399) was an English politician and draper.Oxf. Hist. Soc. xviii. 25; Bodl. Twyne ms 23, f. 630.Oxf. Hist. Soc. xxxvii. 17-19; lxvi. no. 735; xc. no. 770.Oxf. Hist. Soc. xviii. 25; Liber Albus Oxoniensis ed. Ellis, no. 175; CCR, 1377-81, p. 51; CPR, 1377-81, p. 304.Cal. Letter Bk. London, H, 398-9; Twyne ms 4, f. 203.Oxf. Hist. Soc. lxix. 183; xc. no. 511; xci. 178, 184; (ser. 2), xiv. 3-4, 14-17; xx. 6.Twyne ms 23, f. 630; Oxf. Hist. Soc. lxix. 250. ==Family== Somerset lived in St. Martin's parish, near Carfax, Oxford, with his wife, Helen, and their one son. Helen died in 1399. Somerset was last recorded in 1396. There is no record of their son after their deaths. ==Career== He was a Member (MP) of the Parliament of England for Oxford in 1379 and February 1388. He was Mayor of Oxford in 1392–93.http://www.historyofparliamentonline.org/volume/1386-1421/member/somerset- thomas ==References== Category:14th-century births Category:Year of death missing Category:English MPs 1379 Category:English MPs February 1388 Category:Mayors of Oxford
title: Thomas Somerset (MP for Oxford)
